abstract: In the matter of S.E.C. v. Goldman Sachs, two European banks were burned: ABN Amro and IKB Deutsche Industrial Bank — well-known in Germany in 2007 as a Krisenbank, a bank in crisis.
snippet: In the matter of S.E.C. v. Goldman Sachs, two European banks were burned: ABN Amro and IKB Deutsche Industrial Bank — well-known in Germany in 2007 as a Krisenbank, a bank in crisis.
lead_paragraph: In the matter of the Securities and Exchange Commission v. Goldman Sachs, two European banks were burned: ABN Amro and IKB Deutsche Industriebank — well-known in Germany in 2007 as a Krisenbank, a bank in crisis.

headline.main: Abacus Casualty No. 2: IKB, of Duesseldorf
